issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: enable container reuse for grace hash join

comments.body: [~hagleitn] The 4th patch looks good. The only thing I want to confirm is a naming issue: do we want it to be "HybridGraceHashJoin" or "HybridHashJoin" or "GraceHashJoin"? The naming better be consistent. To me "HybridGraceHashJoin" sounds better, considering its difference between classic grace/hybrid hash join.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12725428 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Except vectorized_context, all other mismatches are expected due to explain change.

Below is the query and backtrace for vectorized_context:
{code:sql}
select store.s_city, ss_net_profit
from store_sales
JOIN store ON store_sales.ss_store_sk = store.s_store_sk
JOIN household_demographics ON store_sales.ss_hdemo_sk = household_demographics.hd_demo_sk
limit 100

Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.vector.BytesColumnVector cannot be cast to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.vector.LongColumnVector
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.vector.expressions.VectorExpressionWriterFactory$VectorExpressionWriterLong.writeValue(VectorExpressionWriterFactory.java:175)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.vector.VectorMapJoinOperator.getRowObject(VectorMapJoinOperator.java:347)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.vector.VectorMapJoinOperator.spillBigTableRow(VectorMapJoinOperator.java:306)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.MapJoinOperator.process(MapJoinOperator.java:390)
	... 24 more
{code}

I'm not sure what is going on here.

Probably I think we are forming the vector expression writers incorrectly in the new code we added.  I need to go study the code and think.
